Projects

Web development side projects

Automating an email management system

My team at FAO had an overly complicated email list system that had to be manually updated. It was unmanageable and very time consuming, so I hacked up a new little system with Google Forms, Sheets and Google Apps Scripts. Now our users can signup and unsubscribe themselves from our email notifications, meeting attendance is registered through a tablet and our mailing lists are always updated! Read the full story

Front-end web development projects

In my free time, I love to build small projects to experiment with a design, explore new technologies and learn new things. Few I’m quite happy with are:

  • A Pomodoro Clock, a time management method to be more productive
  • A Javascript Calculator
  • Wikipedia Viewer, an app which allows to search Wikipedia entries
  • A presentation on the CFS 42nd session Side Events, made with Reveal.js and C3.js
  • Email2CSV, a small Python script to convert all emails contained in a text file into a csv file. Very useful to build up mailing lists!

This website!

I coded this portfolio website from scratch with Jekyll and good ol’ HTML and CSS to showcase my most recent work. Feel free to check out the code on Github
